item.title: Building Without Nails: The Genius of Japanese Carpentry
item.description:
Building Without Nails: The Genius of Japanese Carpentry

We've heard of the genius "technology" used in ancient times to build towering monuments with nothing more than primitive tools like stones and ropes. The Egyptian pyramids of old is a great example. Back in the far east, Japan had plenty to offer the ancient world as well when it came to resourceful inventions and crafts.

item.title: A Color Alphabet
item.description:
A Color Alphabet

Artist Christian Faur has created a system for identifying 26 distinct colors, based on the alphabet.

item.title: Thousands of Amiga games now available to play in your web browser
item.description:
Thousands of Amiga games now available to play in your web browser

The Internet Archive is at it again, this time uploading a massive collection of over 2,000 classic Amiga games for you to play. These are directly playable in your web browser, no emulator required.

item.title: Games Replay
item.description:
Games Replay

This is my quest to chronicle the history of computer games. Over the next few years, or as long as I still have the interest and patience, I will collect, install, run, play and review every (significant) game ever made, in chronological order. I will consider all platforms, including computers, consoles and arcades.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
About Me

Hi, Iâ€™m Hesham! I am an engineer, entrepreneur and venture capitalist. But this website is not about that. Actually, it could be about that too, but also about all the other things that arouse my curiosity and sentiment, or distract me for hours.
